stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è Tuesday Night Trollball: Survival in the Shadows! üéôÔ∏è

Well hello there, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter, the demon with the dream, coming to you live and loud from the Aegis Field in Haven! üèüÔ∏è We are deep in the trenches of the Losers Bracket for Game Three of this Best of Five series, and boy oh boy, you can practically smell the desperation in the air! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures are looking to claw their way back, while the Haven Lights are trying to defend their 'holy' turf. It's a high-stakes struggle where the loser might just be heading back to the regeneration pits for a long, long time! Gee whiz, I haven't been this excited since Artorias and Morgwae broke me out of the Demon Prison! ‚õìÔ∏è

The atmosphere here at the Temple of Light is usually so quiet you can hear a saint's conscience, but today the Monteforte crowd has brought enough rowdiness to shake the monastery foundations! ‚õ™ I see Lian Denton over there for the Chaos Creatures, currently downing a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup‚Äînow that is what I call a pre-game fuel-up! On the other side of the pitch, Zwart Bunns is leaning over the Trollball, whispering a secret fear into its leather ears. I hope he told it he's afraid of Alben Diantha's hammer, because the Chaos crew looks like they are ready to remodel some faces! üßä

The 'Twinlight's Glow' is shining down on us, but don't let that fool you! These teams are here to commit some beautiful, sanctioned violence! Those 'heroes' from Haven might have the home-field advantage with their 'Shield's Watch,' but the Chaos Creatures have brought the grit of the graffiti-covered streets of New Monteforte! üõ°Ô∏è We‚Äôve got a playoff atmosphere that would make even Lord Orzalon crack a smile! So grab your tankards and hold onto your hats, because this Losers Bracket battle is about to blow the roof off the Aegis Field! Let's get to the carnage! üí•
postGame:
# üèÜ Chaos Reigns! Creatures Wallop the Lights! üèÜ

Holy Mackerel, what a total and absolute shellacking! Nok the Corrupter here, and my horns are still vibrating from the sheer impact of those hits! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures didn't just win; they essentially dismantled the Haven Lights with an 8 to 2 victory that‚Äôll be talked about in the taverns for decades! üèüÔ∏è Those 'heroes' of Haven looked more like wet noodles out there today, and I couldn't be happier to see their pristine field covered in the mud of a Monteforte masterpiece! üé®‚ùå

The action started fast and mean, just the way we like it! Mouldon Earl decided he didn't like the cut of the Lights' jib and absolutely leveled Riffle Heyde, sending the healer straight into the dirt! üöë But Earl wasn't done! Minutes later, he caught Shiroma Salim with a tackle that sounded like a dry branch snapping in a graveyard. Talk about an early wake-up call for the home crowd! The 'Shield's Watch' was clearly looking the other way while their boys were getting flattened! üõ°Ô∏èüí•

But the Havenites tried to fight back, I'll give 'em that‚Äîthough it was a pathetic effort! Farand Keil managed to get a few hits in, injuring both Placido Kora and then Mouldon Earl in retaliation. It was a brief flicker of hope for the Lights, like a candle in a hurricane! üïØÔ∏è They were scrambling to keep possession, but the Chaos Creatures were playing with the kind of desperation you only see in the Losers Bracket! It was a total grind-fest in the center field!

As the game stretched into overtime, that‚Äôs when the real magic happened! Wolbrom Ariella‚Äîthat sea-shanty-singing beauty‚Äîfound a pocket of space in the Away Field and let fly with a magnificent shoot! üéØ SCORES! Two points for the Chaos Creatures! The visiting fans went absolutely feral, nearly toppling the unstable scaffolding in their excitement! It was the kind of precision that would make Sawyer the rogue jealous, if he wasn't so busy being a circus escapee! üé™

Wolbrom wasn't finished yet, folks! Like a demon possessed, they snagged the ball again in the center field and fired off another thunderous shot! üèπ Another two points! The scoreboard was starting to look as lopsided as Governor-King Zenku's crown after a rough night! The Haven defense was stumbling around like they'd spent too much time at an open bar, though I suspect it was just the sheer force of the Monteforte offense that had them dizzy! üçπüòµ

The injuries just kept piling up! Fogel Raynold, not wanting to be left out of the fun, caught Wieren Ivar with a horseman's pick tackle that sent the Light's star player to the sidelines with an injury! üöë It was a beautiful display of the 'unruly' spirit! Even Boulanger Procto joined in, meticulously arranging Shiroma Salim's gear‚Äîby which I mean he tackled him so hard his helmet ended up in the third row! üõ°Ô∏èüî®

Raouf Dragone then put the final nail in the coffin! With a trident in one hand and the Trollball in the other, they advanced through the center field and let fly with another scoring shoot! üî± That brought the tally to 8, and at that point, you could practically see the lights going out in the monastery windows. The 'Twinlight's Glow' was looking more like a dim ember of failure! üïØÔ∏èüëé

I have to mention Tybi Reo of the Lights. She managed to injure Raouf Dragone earlier, and her team snagged two points somewhere in the chaos, but it was too little, too late! üèà The Haven offense was as disorganized as Sir Tanos trying to read a menu! They were dropping passes left and right, with Zwart Bunns even fumbling a key exchange that led to another Monteforte surge. It was a comedy of errors for the so-called 'heroes'! ü§°

By the end of the match, the Chaos Creatures had turned the Aegis Field into a beautiful disaster. Placido Kora was taking out players, Tucker Hett was injuring Marlane Lounge, and the injury list was longer than a warlock's scroll! üìú It was a defensive masterclass that proved rebellion thrives even in the holiest of compounds! Dame Terra Monteforte must be cackling in her dirt-throne tonight, knowing her crew just embarrassed the Haven elite on their own hallowed ground! üåã

So, the final score stands at 8 to 2! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures keep their playoff hopes alive in this Best of Five, while the Haven Lights are left to pray for a miracle in Game Four! üèÜ I‚Äôm going to go find where Lian Denton hides that hot gravy and see if I can't find something a bit stronger to celebrate this Monteforte victory! Until next time, keep your maces high and your healers closer! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from a very happy, very bloody Aegis Field! üéôÔ∏èüòà
